column2: and you may also end up waiting for anywhere from 10 minutes to half an hour depending on when you arrive
column3: and end up sitting quite closely to some strangers.  But that's just how things are done when it comes to Texas BBQ
column5: so I didn't think too much of it.  Sucks in the winter to wait outside
column6: but you can always call ahead for pick up or to check if they haven't run out of brisket (or whatever is your fancy).
